fees.waiverText: No fee waiver available. Renewal benefit of ₹35,000 voucher on spending ₹20 Lakhs in membership year.

eligibility.notes: ₹15 LPA for Self-Employed. Must have good credit history with no defaults.

rewards.name: Membership Rewards Points
rewards.earningText: 1 MR point per ₹40 spent. At base redemption (₹0.25/point), this equals 0.625% return.
rewards.joiningBonus: Taj vouchers worth ₹45,000 on spending ₹50,000 within first 2 months of card membership and payment of annual fee

calculator.specialLogic: 3X MR points on international spends. 5X MR points via Reward Multiplier on 50+ brands. Up to 20X via Rewards Xcelerator on luxury brands.

redemption.bestOption: Transfer to Marriott Bonvoy (1:1) for hotel redemptions. Value can reach ₹0.75-1.0 per point with good hotel redemptions.

options.desc: Transfer to Emirates, Singapore, BA, etc.

lounge.international: Unlimited (Amex Global Lounge Collection including Centurion, Priority Pass, Plaza Premium, etc.)
lounge.accessType: Amex Centurion Lounges + Priority Pass + Plaza Premium + Delta + Escape

milestones.benefit: ₹35,000 voucher (Taj/Luxe/Postcard) on ₹20L spend + renewal fee payment

golf.text: Unlimited complimentary rounds at premium golf courses in India and select international courses

fuel.text: No fuel benefits - fuel excluded from rewards

features.concierge: 24x7 Platinum Concierge for travel, dining, lifestyle assistance
features.digitalSubscriptions: Ace by Times Prime (WSJ+Mint, Vogue, Conde Nast Traveler, SonyLiv Premium, Disney+ Hotstar)

metadata.bestFor: High-net-worth individuals seeking premium lifestyle benefits, hotel elite status, and unlimited lounge access
metadata.verdict: India's most prestigious card with unmatched hotel memberships and lifestyle benefits. The ₹77,880 (incl. GST) annual fee is justified if you use the hotel status and lounge access extensively.
pros: Unlimited global lounge access including Centurion Lounges
cons: Low base reward rate (1 point per ₹40)
No rewards on fuel, utilities, insurance

fees.waiverText: Renewal fee may be waived 50-100% on request based on annual spending (typically ₹2L+ spend). First year fee ₹1,000, second year onwards ₹4,500.

eligibility.notes: Self-employed must have 12+ months trading history. Savings/current account required with Indian/multinational bank.

rewards.name: Membership Rewards Points
rewards.earningText: 1 MR point per ₹50 spent including utilities (capped at 10,000 points/month on utilities). Base value at ₹0.25/point = 0.5% return.
rewards.joiningBonus: 4,000 MR points on spending ₹10,000 within 90 days of card membership + annual fee payment
rewards.exclusions: Insurance, Cash Transactions. Fuel excluded from June 12, 2025.

calculator.specialLogic: 1,000 bonus MR points on completing 6 transactions of ₹1,000+ each in a calendar month. 5X MR points via Reward Multiplier.

redemption.bestOption: Redeem for 18K/24K Gold Collection vouchers. Taj voucher at 24K gives ₹0.58/point value.

milestones.benefit: 1,000 bonus MR points on 6 transactions of ₹1,000+ each month
5,000 MR points on first renewal with annual fee payment

features.hotelBenefits: The Hotel Collection: $100 hotel credit + room upgrade on 2+ night stays at 400+ hotels worldwide (Hilton, Hyatt, IHG)

metadata.bestFor: Those who want MR points on utility bills and fuel, with iconic gold card design and no preset spending limit
metadata.verdict: One of the few cards in India that rewards utility and fuel spends. The iconic gold design and 18K/24K Gold Collection make it attractive for Amex enthusiasts.
pros: Earns MR points on utility bills (capped)
Earns MR points on fuel (till June 2025)
Monthly bonus of 1,000 MR on 6x ₹1,000 transactions
cons: Caps on utility and fuel rewards

name: American Express Membership Rewards Credit Card

fees.waiverText: 100% annual fee waiver on ₹1.5L spend. 50% waiver on ₹90K-₹1.5L spend. First year fee ₹1,000 (free on referral).

eligibility.notes: Monthly income of ₹35,000+ for salaried. Self-employed need ITR of ₹4.5L+.

rewards.name: Membership Rewards Points
rewards.earningText: 1 MR point per ₹50 spent. Base value at ₹0.25/point = 0.5% return. Can reach 5-7% with milestones.
rewards.joiningBonus: 4,000 MR points on spending ₹15,000 within 90 days + annual fee payment
rewards.exclusions: Fuel, Utilities, Insurance, Cash Transactions, EMI at POS

calculator.specialLogic: 1,000 bonus MR on 4 transactions of ₹1,500+ each month. Additional 1,000 bonus MR on spending ₹20,000+ in a month. 5X via Reward Multiplier.

redemption.bestOption: 18K/24K Gold Collection vouchers or Marriott Bonvoy transfer for best value.

milestones.benefit: 1,000 bonus MR points on 4 transactions of ₹1,500+ each month
Additional 1,000 bonus MR points on spending ₹20,000+ in a calendar month
5,000 MR points on first renewal with annual fee payment

fuel.text: 0% convenience fee at HPCL for transactions under ₹5,000

metadata.bestFor: First-time Amex users who can hit monthly milestones for high effective reward rate. Part of popular Amex Trifecta strategy.
metadata.verdict: Best entry-level Amex card with easy milestone bonuses. Spending ₹20K/month with 4x ₹1,500 transactions yields 2,400 bonus MR points - excellent for its fee bracket.
cons: No rewards on fuel, utilities, insurance
High renewal fee (₹4,500) if waiver not earned

fees.waiverText: Annual fee waived on spending ₹40,000+ in the previous card membership year.

eligibility.notes: Entry-level Amex card. Self-employed need ITR. Available in select cities only.

rewards.name: Membership Rewards Points
rewards.earningText: 1 MR point per ₹50 spent. 10X on select partners (capped). 5X on Amazon (capped).
rewards.joiningBonus: ₹500 cashback on spending ₹10,000 within first 90 days
rewards.exclusions: Fuel, Utilities, Insurance, Cash Transactions, EMI at POS

calculator.specialLogic: 10X on Zomato+EaseMyTrip (500 pts/month combined). 10X on Flipkart, Myntra, Uber, Ajio, Nykaa, PVR, BookMyShow, BlinkIt (500 pts/month combined). 5X on Amazon (250 pts/month). Total accelerated cap: 1,250 pts/month.

online.label: 10X on Flipkart, Myntra, Ajio, Nykaa (capped 500/month combined)

redemption.bestOption: Pool with MRCC/Gold Charge for 18K/24K Gold Collection. Otherwise, redeem for statement credit or basic vouchers.

options.desc: Pool with MRCC for Taj at ₹0.50/point

milestones.benefit: ₹500 voucher on spending ₹1.2 Lakhs in card membership year

fuel.text: 0% convenience fee at HPCL under ₹5,000. 1% above ₹5,000.

metadata.bestFor: Online shoppers using Flipkart, Amazon, Zomato, Uber with low monthly spends. Entry point to Amex ecosystem.
metadata.verdict: Decent entry-level card for online shopping with 10X/5X accelerated rewards, but monthly caps are very low. Best as gateway to Amex ecosystem.
cons: Very low monthly caps (500+500+250 = 1,250 pts max)

name: American Express Platinum Reserve Credit Card

fees.waiverText: 100% annual fee waiver on spending ₹10 Lakhs in the preceding membership year.

eligibility.notes: Self-employed need 12+ months trading history. Premium card targeting frequent travelers and high spenders.

rewards.name: Membership Rewards Points
rewards.earningText: 1 MR point per ₹50 spent. Base value at ₹0.25/point = 0.5% return. Monthly vouchers add significant value.
rewards.joiningBonus: 11,000 MR points on spending ₹30,000 within 90 days + joining fee payment
rewards.exclusions: Fuel, Utilities, Insurance, Cash Transactions, EMI at POS

calculator.specialLogic: ₹1,000 monthly voucher on spending ₹50,000/month (enrollment required). 5X MR points via Reward Multiplier. Golf access on ₹50K monthly spend.

redemption.bestOption: Transfer to Marriott Bonvoy or airline partners. Monthly vouchers provide best recurring value.

options.desc: Transfer to Emirates, BA, Singapore, etc.

lounge.domestic: 12 visits/year (max 3 per quarter) at partner lounges
lounge.international: 2 visits/year via Priority Pass (US$35 per additional visit)
lounge.accessType: Partner Lounges + Priority Pass (complimentary membership, $99 fee waived)

milestones.benefit: ₹1,000 voucher on spending ₹50,000 in a calendar month (up to ₹12,000/year)
Taj Stay voucher worth ₹10,000 on ₹5L spend + annual fee payment

golf.text: 2 complimentary rounds/month at 32+ golf courses on ₹50,000 monthly spend

fuel.text: 0% convenience fee at HPCL under ₹5,000. 1% above ₹5,000.

hotelMemberships: Taj Epicure (10% off stays, late checkout, dining discounts)
EazyDiner Prime (up to 50% off at 1800+ restaurants)
Accor Plus Explorer (30% off dining, member rates)
The Hotel Collection ($100 credit + upgrade on 2+ night stays)
features.concierge: 24x7 Platinum Concierge for dining reservations, travel, lifestyle assistance

metadata.bestFor: High spenders (₹50K+/month) who can maximize monthly vouchers, golf benefits, and hotel memberships
metadata.verdict: Good for those spending ₹50K+/month to earn ₹12K in annual vouchers. The ₹10L spend requirement for fee waiver is steep. Accor Plus and dining memberships add value.
pros: Complimentary Taj Epicure, EazyDiner Prime, Accor Plus
cons: ₹10L spend needed for fee waiver (unrealistic for most)
